availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
1
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To any Sheriff or Constable of Christian Co --

It appearing that there are reasonable grounds for believing that Pinknery Yancy has committed the offense of Shooting Robert T Coleman with a pistol with intent to kill, in the County of Christian -- You are therefore Commanded forthwith to arrest Pinkney Yancy and bring him before me, and some other Justice of the peace for said County to be dealt with according to Law --
Given under my hand as Justice of the peace of Christian County this 9' day of December 1865
Eexcutd Decr 9 -- 1865 on the within named Pinkney Yancey by apprehending him and bringing him before Wm Hauelson & Wm W Sargent two Justices of the peace for Christian county for trial
D T Brown c c c

Pinkney A Yancy, having been brought before Wm Harrelson & W W Sargent two Justices of the peace for christian
2
County for an examination of the charge of having unlawfully shot Robert S Coleman with intent to kill, and being allowed to give Bail for his appearance during the examination of the charge, now I William Yancy of the County of Christian and State of Kentucky do undertake that Said Pinkney A Yancy will appear in Said Examining Court at Pembroke Christian County Ky, on Tuesday 12t day of Decer 1865 and will render himself amenable to all the order of Said Court in the examination of the charge, and if he fail to perform either of these conditions I will pay to the Commonwealth of Ky One Thousand Dollars
Witness our hands & Seals this 9t day Decr 1865

P A ^his X mark^ Yancey
W B Yancey

Witness
W W Sargent
William Harrelson --

Joseph I Laudes Esqr the county attorney appeared before us this day as prosecutor in behalf of the Commonwealth of the within named Pinkney A Yancey
3
And the said Yancey was called but faild to appear and this Bond is forfeited -- This at Pembroke in Said County

William Harrelson J P
Wm W Sergeant J P --

I Joab Clark Clerk of the Circuit Court for Siad County Certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the warrant & Bail Bond returned into my office by the above named Justices on the 16' December 1865

Joab Clark clk
By A H Clark D C
